Title: Frustrated double and single ionization in a two-electron triatomic molecule H+ 3
Source: J Phys B At Mol Opt Phys
Abstract: © 2016 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.Using a semi-classical model, we study the formation of highly excited neutral fragments during the fragmentation of H3 + , a two-electron triatomic molecule, driven by an intense near-IR laser field. To do so, we first formulate a microcanonical distribution for arbitrary one-electron triatomic molecules. We then study frustrated double and single ionization in strongly driven H3 +and compute the kinetic energy release of the nuclei for these two processes. Moreover, we investigate the dependence of frustrated ionization on the strength of the laser field as well as on the geometry of the initial molecular state.
SubjectAreas: Atomic and Molecular Physics, and Optics
